abstract: Prime Minister Gordon Brown plans to unveil a second bailout for British banks to stoke more lending.
snippet: Prime Minister Gordon Brown plans to unveil a second bailout for British banks to stoke more lending.
lead_paragraph: LONDON  To stabilize a teetering economy, the government bails out several of the nation’s largest banks in hopes that credit will flow again. When that does not work, officials return with yet more taxpayer money and, this time, new initiatives to goad banks into lending.

headline.main: British Banks, After Bailout, in Line for More
headline.print_headline: In Britain, New Round For Bailout
